ygData.subject: Re: Grrrrrrrr!
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ll be honest with you all.  When I say, stone spider on track, or nox on track, the druids are reporting the same exact thing at the same exact time.
ygData.messageBody:
> Well we definatly wouldn't want to increase the cap to a level above bards,
> as to do so would devalue the ranger. The bard cap, to be honest, is set too
> high, but we'll just live with that.

I'll be honest with you all. When I say, stone spider on track, or
nox on track, the druids are reporting the same exact thing at the
same exact time. That's 20 vs. 100. I wouldn't mind our tracking
cap lower whatsoever, to 75 or even 60. They could then raise
druids to 40. This is such a non-issue, tracking ranges are
not affected greatly by slight skill differences. A ranger can,
however, track Djarn from the bat cave, where I cannot. So that's
the difference between 100 and 200. Otherwise, I can see everything
else the ranger can.

Harmonic.
